algorithm_technique: Check for overlap by ensuring the intersection of x-intervals and y-intervals is positive.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if two rectangles intersect, meaning they share a positive area.
problem_summary_technical: Rectangles overlap if their x-intervals and y-intervals both have a positive intersection length.
key_insights: Two rectangles do not overlap if one is entirely to the left, right, above, or below the other.
Overlap occurs if the right edge of one is to the right of the left edge of the other, and vice-versa for both axes.
The condition `max(p_left, q_left) < min(p_right, q_right)` efficiently checks for positive interval overlap.
